Payroll Requirements

Review Pay Groups section in BRS-Launch Tool. Explain concept of Pay Group in UltiPro. In UltiPro, pay groups primarily define a pay frequency.  However, other considerations exist.  Different payroll bank accounts necessitate different pay groups.  Different period start/end/pay dates also necessitate different pay groups.
questions.reason:
The system uses a pay group to establish a payroll schedule for a specific group of employees. Some of the information and criteria used to establish different pay groups are:
1) To pay groups of employees on different payroll schedules. For example, one pay group can be paid weekly and another pay group can be paid semi-monthly.
2) To establish payroll process steps specific to each pay group. For example, one pay group may require only check printing and another pay group may require creation of the direct deposit bank file and printing of direct deposit advices.
3) To identify different payroll bank accounts for different groups of employees.
4) To establish a net pay general ledger code for a specific group of employees.
5) To separate employees for security purposes. For example, you can establish a pay group for the executive employees and establish limited access to that pay group.
questions.action:
OR, WA, MN will all need to separate - essentially every state will get their own (AZ might be broken out by stores and car wash)
-- the pay groups will not remain as they currently are within UKG
--JFS is broken down by states because of the high # of employees
-- from admin perspective, everything is separate for extra mile and by state for JFS so sometimes things can get missed for extra mile

questions.question: Review the Earnings tab from the BRS-Launch Tool.
questions.reason: See also: Earnings Tax Category Matrix

questions.question: Review pay calculations for each earning codes
questions.reason:
For the states of WA, MN, and OR, the hours worked for state unemployment need to be sent in order to file the SUI returns correctly. If you have employees in WA, MN, MA, or OR, you need to make sure that the earning calculation rule associated to the earning code for regular pay is:
1) “Pay Rate * Hours * Rate Factor” 
2)  “Period pay, track scheduled hours” (This rule may be used for employees that are paid the same amount every pay period and for whom the scheduled hours need to be tracked. 
3) Another calculation rule that uses hours 

The “Period Pay” calculation rule should not be used as this is for employees who are paid the same amount every pay period and for whom no hours need to be tracked, entered, or changed. 

NOTE:  This is for productive time only.  Bonus, Fringe, etc. can continue to have the Flat amount calc rule attached.
questions.action:
Truck drivers are paid by the load which could be similar to piece rate
-- CA codes need to recognize flat sum (need to review those CA codes they have setup and see if UKG can habdle this for FLSA overtime)

• Group Term Life imputed income for coverage over $50,000

• Wages paid in kind (p. 11 of Circular E)
• Dependent Care FSA/Health Care FSA Reimbursements

• Employee Loans

questions.question: What is a Predecessor and Successor?
questions.reason: What tax codes does Payment Services not Support?

questions.question: A predecessor-successor relationship exists when a transfer occurs and one business (successor) acquires all or part of another business (predecessor). It may arise from the transfer of operating assets including, but not limited to, the transfer of one or more employees from a predecessor to a successor. It may also arise from an internal reorganization of affiliated companies. A predecessor-successor relationship also exists when an employer transfers its business to another employer, and both employers are at the time of transfer under substantially common ownership, management or control. Whether or not a predecessor-successor relationship (including a "partial predecessor" or "partial successor" relationship) exists depends on the totality of the circumstances.

questions.reason: If multiple people are printing checks, my need additional pay groups.

If printing checks (and not already provided), have the customer request MICR specs from the bank.

questions.reason: Ask client to inform banks about the change. Also provide overview of file creation for check print files upon finishing a payroll.

questions.question: Provide a voided payroll check for each bank account.

Would you like UKG to print your regular payroll checks?  
Would you prefer to print your own regular payroll checks?  Explain UKG will only print regular checks. Any manual/off-cycle/instant checks will need to be printed in house.
questions.reason:
Check Print
• Direct Deposit Only – All employees get direct deposit, no need for checks (preferred method)
• In House – Preprinted check stock
o HP Printer Recommended
o No MICR toner cartridge necessary
o Signature and logo can be included on check file coming from UltiPro 
o Checks can be ordered from the UKG Forms Division (Support site – Services > UKG Provided services > Forms Division > Request for information).  
o Check format must be Full page Top Check 
• In House – Blank check stock
o HP Printer Recommended
o Customer may need to purchase a MICR toner cartridge 
o Signature and logo can be included on check file coming from UltiPro 
o Contact forms department
o Options for Signature & Logo 
o Check format must be Full page Top Check 
•  UltiPro Check Print Service 
o Beneficial if client has multiple locations (Split-wrap)

Please note that UKG only supports Windows-native printers within the SaaS environment. If the printers that you utilize do not have a native Windows driver we cannot guarantee all client printers will perform adequately.  Also all check stock should be ordered from the UKG Forms Division.

questions.question: Will manual checks be printed from an UltiPro pdf file onsite, or be entered as post-only checks to be paid out by Accounts Payable?

questions.reason: If not pre-printed, client will need to have a printer with MICR toner. If pre-printed, additional bank setup is necessary (set up separate bank to be used for Instant Checks).

Default Password - Initial Login

Default Password
1) Birthdate <Workplace Standard>
2) Randomly generated - If randomly generated, employees must have a valid work email entered during new hire entry.

questions.question: Multi-Factor Authentication
Do you require multi-factor authentication upon logging in to the UltiPro portal?
questions.reason:
When the multi-factor security option for log in is enabled, users that require access must request a five-digit access code to gain authorized secure entry to UltiPro. Users can select from up to three delivery methods to receive the access code. The access code is delivered via text message, voice message, or e-mail. Once the access code is delivered, it may be entered on the Enter Access Code page within a limited time period.

Note: Our recommendation is to select text and/or voice as the delivery method. Email is not recommended.

Additionally, trusted devices can be identified. Users are not prompted for an access code when a device is trusted. However, there is a maximum time period that a device can be configured as trusted. The options for time periods that a device can be trusted include 1, 7, 14, and 30 days. When the selected time period expires, users are asked for an access code at the time of next log in. The trusted period then restarts.

questions.question: Do you require multi-factor authentication in order to access the Form W-2, Form I-9 and Private Info pages on employee records?
questions.reason:
When enabled, managers and employee administrators must request a five-digit security access code on the Security Access Code Request page to view sensitive employee information.

The security access code is delivered to managers and employee administrators via text message, voice message, or e-mail.

questions.question: Do you need IP Filtering?
questions.reason:
Role based Internet Protocol (IP) address filters provide System Administrators with the ability to restrict users assigned to one, multiple, or all roles from accessing UltiPro from locations that do not match the filter-defined IP address range.

When filters are applied and a user logs into UltiPro, the login request includes the originating IP address for the user’s location. Based on the defined IP address filters, the following scenarios apply:

·  If the originating IP address is within the filtered range of addresses, the user is granted access to UltiPro with the appropriate access rights according to the assigned role(s).

·  If the originating IP address is outside the filtered range, and ALL the user’s assigned roles are restricted by the filter, the user is unable to log into UltiPro from the current location.

·  If the originating IP address is outside the filtered range, and SOME of the user’s assigned roles are restricted by the filter, the user will be granted restricted access to UltiPro (according to role(s) not restricted by the filter). For example, a user with assigned roles of Employee and System Administrator could be restricted from access as a System Administrator based on their originating IP address, but be granted access to Employee functions from the same location.

Note: When ALL roles are denied access for an IP Address Filter and a user logs in from outside of the filtered IP address range, the following message appears on the Login page: Access is denied. Contact your system administrator.

questions.question: How would you like to treat terminated employees?  Should they retain access to UltiPro after they are terminated or should they lose access to the web portal upon termination?  If they should retain web access, to print their W2 for example, should they lose access to specific pages and actions, like change name and address for example?
questions.reason: Terminated employees with an active user status, regardless of role, are billed at the rate of $1 per month.  They are considered terminated web access employees.  The only way for a customer to not incur a billing fee for terminated employees is to set the System Settings to “Suspend upon termination”, for the customer to manually suspend the terminated employees web access, or for the customer to manually delete the terminated user.

This can affect parallel testing; the client may need to update employee numbers in a UD Field for parallel testing purposes. Determine the logic for data conversion purposes to ease parallel testing and ensure expected results.

You are looking for any fields that you may not have discussed and are ensuring all employee data in their current system will have a home in UltiPro. This exercise can lead to identifying the need for a user-defined field. Always discuss "non-standard" data that the customer is tracking to be sure they absolutely need to track that it in UltiPro and that it is well-maintained.
Paid Time Off Plan Types
How many types of accrued paid time off plans do you offer? (Floating holiday, vacation, sick, personal)
For each type of accrued plan, how many different plans are offered?
How many types of non-accrued paid time off plans do you offer? (Bereavement, Jury Duty, military leave). Should these plans reduce regular pay?
questions.reason: Make sure there's an earncode for each type of plan and that they are flagged appropriately.

questions.question: Do plans differ by employee type (e.g. Full-Time/Part-Time, Salary/Hourly)?
How do your employees accrue their paid time off?
questions.reason:
Types of Accruals:
1)      Per Fixed Date  
               Example:  Every January 1st  
2)      Per Pay Period  
               Example:  Every pay period
3)      Per Included Hours/Dollars
               Example:  Every pay period for selected earning codes
4)      Per Elapsed Time (# Weeks, # Month, # Years)  
               Example:  Every 1 year on service anniversary (date of seniority).

questions.question: Do any of your plans accrue based on hours worked? If so, which earning codes should be included in that calculation and what is the amount accrued per hour worked?
Are there any state-mandated requirements for any of your PTO plans?
questions.reason: Are they subject to the San Francisco Paid Sick Leave Ordinance? Or does their sick plan adequately cover all of their employees in San Francisco?

questions.question: Is there a wait period before employees can begin accruing?
Is there a waiting period before employees can take PTO?
questions.reason:
In UltiPro this wait period is known as “Pending”.  Some plans have a waiting period where the employee can accrue but cannot use accruals immediately.
1)      Hold once and move:  Employees must wait for a specific time only at the beginning of their employment.  This is known as a One-Time Pending Rule 
2)      No Pending:   Accrual available immediately.

questions.question: Does the rate of accrual vary based on the employee’s length of service? Length of service for PTO accruals is determined in UltiPro by using the Seniority Date. Does this present any issues with how seniority date is used by the client?
questions.reason:
If yes, enter on the length of service, and accrual rate for each identified length of service and rate.
If no, enter one line on the rate page with a length of service amount of 99 years and rate amount.

questions.question: Is there a limit to the amount of the accrual per check?
questions.reason:
This is typically used for “per included earnings” or “per included hour’s” accrual rules.
If yes, enter the amount on the rates tab in Max per check.  This amount can vary by length of service.
If no, enter zero or leave blank on the rates tab in Max per check.

questions.question: Is there a limit (maximum) to the amount of Pending, Allowed, Available or Permitted time?
questions.reason:
1) Pending:  Amount earned by the employee which cannot be taken immediately.  
2) Allowed:  Amount earned by the employee which can be taken immediately.  
3) Available:  The total of the Allowed time minus the total of the amount Taken equals the employee’s Available balance.
4) Permitted: Represents the maximum hours an employee can request for a PTO benefit plan based on a given length of service

Note:  If you leave the max pending, max available, or max allowed field blank or enter 0 then the maximum amount is, by default, unlimited.

questions.question: Do your accruals reset?
questions.reason:
If no, the Allowed and Taken balances will grow forever.   Rollover rule is “No Rollover”.   
If yes, when do the Allowed and Taken balances reset?
1)      Per Fixed Date
Example:  Every January 1st
2)      Per Elapsed Time (# Weeks, # Month, # Years)  
Example:  Every 1 year on service anniversary (date of seniority)

questions.question: If accruals reset, are employees allowed to carry any balances over? How much? Is there any use-it-or-lose-it clause?
questions.reason:
1)      Fixed Amount
Example: 40 hours at end of year
2)      Unlimited Amount:   Everything is carried over.   Enter 999999.  This forces UltiPro to carry over the entire amount on rollover.   
3)      Nothing:   Either enter a zero or leave the max carry over field blank.  No amount will be carried over.
Note:  If you leave the max carry over field blank or enter 0 then the maximum amount to be carried over is, by default, zero.  This is typically used in a ‘use it or lose it’ policy.  If an employee has a negative balance UltiPro WILL carry the amount over even if the amount in the max carry over field amount is blank or zero.

questions.question: If accruals reset, does the employee receive a payout of the unused portion?
If accruals reset, does this happen before or after the accrual for that period?
Should all companies be able to view all PTO Plans?
Explain how initial PTO balances will be loaded prior to parallel testing and then again prior to go live.
